details.description: The bronze optic stamp, which exists somewhere between oddity and treasure, is used to mark blown glass to create a lens for patterned projections. Artificial light projected through the resulting glass object is transformed into a breathing organism.
details.name: Optic Stamp, 2013

details.description:
2013 
tumblr, code 

SHIRITORI, derived from a common word chain game, plays with linking tumblr posts via search, providing an ever-changing roadmap through linking ideas via the language of tags. The site is built with HTML and javascript. The original word chain game involves multiple players creating a chain of words based off the first and last letters of a word (example: apple - elephant - telephone etc.). The process of SHIRITORI is the same except that the role of word is replaced by posts, and letters are replaced by tags. The resulting process is then: 1. Search for a term, 2. Grab a post, 3. Take a different tag from the same post, 4. Search again with new tag. 

You can access SHIRITORI at http://moriandyama.com/shiritori.
details.name: SHIRITORI

modules.embed: <iframe width="600" height="338" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/MIOYqXCOBpw?wmode=transparent" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="" style="margin:0px auto;display:block;"></iframe>

details.description:
2013 
Appropriated images, paper 

Journey to the West appropriates images collected from the internet and reformats them into a three-dimensional collage. Using my own personal experience as a starting point, it is a representation of an online culture which is based in the approximate, filtered understanding of existing cultures offline. The title - based off the a classic Chinese novel about a Buddhist pilgrimage - is a reference to the transfer of Eastern entertainment culture to Western countries. My goal was to use these images to portray a slice of that online culture in a way that indicates its own existence... Not to portray it as its most well-known stereotypes or tropes, but as its own entity as it manifests itself in the identities of its participants. 

This piece was exhibited in ALL THAT GLITTERS IS NOT LEDS, the RISD digital+media biennial in Providence, RI in 2013.
details.name: Journey to the West

details.description: 2D narrative-based sidescrolling game with a hand-drawn and photo collage aesthetic
details.name: Whole

details.description:
2013 
Handmade postcards: inkjet on semi-glossy paper and cardstock 

Can Someone Talk With Me is a collaborative project that explores parallels, intersections, and conflicts between modes of online and offline communication, seeking a relationship between the digital and the analogue. The project cultivates opportunities for individuals to respond to expressions of loneliness on the social media platform Twitter via physical postcards in the “real” world, thus recontextualizing anonymous digital communication. 

This expresses one phase of the project which exists in physical space as interactions with the public and their responses in the form of postcards. The second phase, if successful, will exist online as a functioning and interactive Twitter account, and hopefully as ongoing private correspondances. 

Collaborators: David Kim, Nupur Mathur, Hyo Jin Yoo, and Chihao Yo.
details.name: Can someone talk with me?

details.description:
2013 
Handmade postcards: inkjet on semi-glossy paper and cardstock 

Can Someone Talk With Me is a collaborative project that explores parallels, intersections, and conflicts between modes of online and offline communication, seeking a relationship between the digital and the analogue. The project cultivates opportunities for individuals to respond to expressions of loneliness on the social media platform Twitter via physical postcards in the “real” world, thus recontextualizing anonymous digital communication.

details.name: Can someone talk with me?

details.description:
In any given landscape there are moments, which tell a story about a place and the people that dwell there. In a metropolis or a ghost town these moments of loneliness and abandonment that can be looked over or forgotten. It is in these spaces that there is an opportunity to see and understand the world in a different way. By exploring, collecting and photographing the world as an archaeologist or detective gives intensity to the seemingly banal and ordinary. 

The absence of the human figure in the work provides a space for the viewer to project themselves into the desolate and abandoned environments that are captures. By pairing photographs of these deserted and abandoned environments and images of found personal items it provides fertile ground for narratives to emerge. The items collected are items one might find in a family album or desk drawer and provides a strong connection to the missing figure.

The types of spaces that are captured range greatly from the unnoticed reflection of a New York street to forgotten city in the California desert that has a vibrant past. The ghostly representation of the locations exposes moments of quietness, sadness, and abandonment. In some cases these places are desolate due to a tragedy or economic down turn and the images and collected items speak to the way in which it happened. 

It is the universality of loss that allows the viewer to find the beauty in these abandoned spaces and objects. With the hope that it enlightens them to see how sublime life is and how connected we are to each other.
details.name: At A Loss

modules.text:
At A Loss
 
In any given landscape there are moments, which tell a story about a place and the people that dwell there. In a metropolis or a ghost town these moments of loneliness and abandonment that can be looked over or forgotten. It is in these spaces that there is an opportunity to see and understand the world in a different way. By exploring, collecting and photographing the world as an archaeologist or detective gives intensity to the seemingly banal and ordinary.
 
The absence of the human figure in the work provides a space for the viewer to project themselves into the desolate and abandoned environments that are captures. By pairing photographs of these deserted and abandoned environments and images of found personal items it provides fertile ground for narratives to emerge. The items collected are items one might find in a family album or desk drawer and provides a strong connection to the missing figure.
 
The types of spaces that are captured range greatly from the unnoticed reflection of a New York street to forgotten city in the California desert that has a vibrant past. The ghostly representation of the locations exposes moments of quietness, sadness, and abandonment. In some cases these places are desolate due to a tragedy or economic down turn and the images and collected items speak to the way in which it happened.
 
It is the universality of loss that allows the viewer to find the beauty in these abandoned spaces and objects. With the hope that it enlightens them to see how sublime life is and how connected we are to each other.
modules.text_plain: At A Loss In any given landscape there are moments, which tell a story about a place and the people that dwell there. In a metropolis or a ghost town these moments of loneliness and abandonment that can be looked over or forgotten. It is in these spaces that there is an opportunity to see and understand the world in a different way. By exploring, collecting and photographing the world as an archaeologist or detective gives intensity to the seemingly banal and ordinary. The absence of the human figure in the work provides a space for the viewer to project themselves into the desolate and abandoned environments that are captures. By pairing photographs of these deserted and abandoned environments and images of found personal items it provides fertile ground for narratives to emerge. The items collected are items one might find in a family album or desk drawer and provides a strong connection to the missing figure. The types of spaces that are captured range greatly from the unnoticed reflection of a New York street to forgotten city in the California desert that has a vibrant past. The ghostly representation of the locations exposes moments of quietness, sadness, and abandonment. In some cases these places are desolate due to a tragedy or economic down turn and the images and collected items speak to the way in which it happened. It is the universality of loss that allows the viewer to find the beauty in these abandoned spaces and objects. With the hope that it enlightens them to see how sublime life is and how connected we are to each other.

details.description: To convert an abandoned synagogue into a community center with a focus on food justice.
details.name: Fast Food Temple

modules.text: In this project, I had to convert an abandoned synagogue in South Providence into a gathering center for the community. The focus of the community center was to be based around food justice issues.
modules.text_plain: In this project, I had to convert an abandoned synagogue in South Providence into a gathering center for the community. The focus of the community center was to be based around food justice issues.

modules.text: In an exercise to understand the structure, I created a storyboard pairing that strived to get at the essence of the building.  I found through multiple site visits that the building was all about these barriers/thresholds that one had to step up to in order to reach the main prayer room.  In addition the site had a great sense of memory for what the synagogue once meant to the community.
modules.text_plain: In an exercise to understand the structure, I created a storyboard pairing that strived to get at the essence of the building.  I found through multiple site visits that the building was all about these barriers/thresholds that one had to step up to in order to reach the main prayer room.  In addition the site had a great sense of memory for what the synagogue once meant to the community.

modules.text: Through research I found that the neighborhood is primarily composed of immigrants from a variety of countries.  It is also a poorer community with an average household income of less that $30k.
modules.text_plain: Through research I found that the neighborhood is primarily composed of immigrants from a variety of countries.  It is also a poorer community with an average household income of less that $30k.

modules.text: Based on my research, I concluded that the people in the community didn't have the time or funds for slow food.  It makes sense why fast food is so prevalent within poorer neighborhoods (whole families can be fed with less than $5 and in under 5 minutes).  I studied the history of fast food and its development within society.
modules.text_plain: Based on my research, I concluded that the people in the community didn't have the time or funds for slow food.  It makes sense why fast food is so prevalent within poorer neighborhoods (whole families can be fed with less than $5 and in under 5 minutes).  I studied the history of fast food and its development within society.

modules.text:
Fast food, however, doesn't really provide nutrition and has led to a variety of heath problems.  
For my project, I proposed created a "fast" food temple for the community.  It would maintain the qualities that make fast food appealing BUT it would be better food that would feed the community and the community's economy.
modules.text_plain: Fast food, however, doesn't really provide nutrition and has led to a variety of heath problems.  For my project, I proposed created a "fast" food temple for the community.  It would maintain the qualities that make fast food appealing BUT it would be better food that would feed the community and the community's economy.

modules.text: I changed the main entry by cutting through the large processional stairs and creating a vomitorium.
modules.text_plain: I changed the main entry by cutting through the large processional stairs and creating a vomitorium.

modules.text: The relationship of the building within the neighborhood is changed with the addition of a roof garden that replaces th familiar pediment.
modules.text_plain: The relationship of the building within the neighborhood is changed with the addition of a roof garden that replaces th familiar pediment.

details.description: An exploration of the relationship of scale within interior architecture.
details.name: What is Interior Architecture?

modules.text: Interior Architecture is driven by the human body.  It caters / reacts / fits / controls / emphasizes / distorts / manipulates / predicts / holds / molds to / supports / guides / etc. how the body will move and feel in space. For this project I had to create a paper model for the human scale. If we look at the model at a one to one scale it functions as a protective garment - fitting the body while camouflaging the form. But if we imagine the model to be at 1/8” scale it suddenly becomes a cavernous space the body can freely wander through and explore.
modules.text_plain: Interior Architecture is driven by the human body.  It caters / reacts / fits / controls / emphasizes / distorts / manipulates / predicts / holds / molds to / supports / guides / etc. how the body will move and feel in space. For this project I had to create a paper model for the human scale. If we look at the model at a one to one scale it functions as a protective garment - fitting the body while camouflaging the form. But if we imagine the model to be at 1/8” scale it suddenly becomes a cavernous space the body can freely wander through and explore.

details.description: In the three-minute video, Hands to Touch Molten Glass, a set of bronze hands is activated in the manner of the magician. Using both sleight of hand and lighting tricks, an ethereal visual spectacle is concocted. The technique of sleight of hand is used by magicians and alchemists to manipulate objects secretly. It uses the principles of simulation to give the impression that something has happened that has not. Bronze hands shrouded by the light of the glowing glass conjure notions of the otherworldly. Through artifact and lighting, the viewer is fused to the belief that the impossible has been made possible. For a brief moment one is joined to both the earthly and unearthly.
details.name: Hands to Touch Molten Glass, 2013

modules.text:
Hands to Touch Molten Glass, 2013
 
In the three-minute video, Hands to Touch Molten Glass, a set of bronze hands is activated in the manner of the magician. Using both sleight of hand and lighting tricks, an ethereal visual spectacle is concocted. The technique of sleight of hand is used by magicians and alchemists to manipulate objects secretly. It uses the principles of simulation to give the impression that something has happened that has not. Bronze hands shrouded by the light of the glowing glass conjure notions of the otherworldly. Through artifact and lighting, the viewer is fused to the belief that the impossible has been made possible. For a brief moment one is joined to both the earthly and unearthly.
modules.text_plain: Hands to Touch Molten Glass, 2013 In the three-minute video, Hands to Touch Molten Glass, a set of bronze hands is activated in the manner of the magician. Using both sleight of hand and lighting tricks, an ethereal visual spectacle is concocted. The technique of sleight of hand is used by magicians and alchemists to manipulate objects secretly. It uses the principles of simulation to give the impression that something has happened that has not. Bronze hands shrouded by the light of the glowing glass conjure notions of the otherworldly. Through artifact and lighting, the viewer is fused to the belief that the impossible has been made possible. For a brief moment one is joined to both the earthly and unearthly.

details.description: Using a small box, create a space that depicts a given mood/feeling.
details.name: Mood in a Box

modules.text:
Can space capture the essence of a feeling? We utilize adjective like somber, delicate, rational, etc to describe the character of spaces on a day to day basis. It is an intuitive process we engage with.
 
The challenge for this project was to begin with the mood and create a space from there. Given basic achromatic materials and predetermined dimensions to work with I was assigned three adjectives: happy, disorienting, and otherworldly. I chose to work with happy and otherworldly and then utilized light, form and texture to imbue the space with those traits.
modules.text_plain: Can space capture the essence of a feeling? We utilize adjective like somber, delicate, rational, etc to describe the character of spaces on a day to day basis. It is an intuitive process we engage with. The challenge for this project was to begin with the mood and create a space from there. Given basic achromatic materials and predetermined dimensions to work with I was assigned three adjectives: happy, disorienting, and otherworldly. I chose to work with happy and otherworldly and then utilized light, form and texture to imbue the space with those traits.
